results.title: If I should fall from grace: the Shane MacGowan story
results.creator_credit: Sarah Share, Emdee 2000 Productions, Irish Film Board and TG4
results.brief_description: This Irish documentary plots the legendary musician Shane MacGowan’s rise to fame, and infamy, as the lead singer of Irish band “The Pogues” and his subsequent dismissal. Along with footage of live performances, video clips and an extended contemporary interview with MacGowan, this documentary also contains illuminating discussions with friends, family, colleagues, and fellow musicians Nick Cave, Philip Chevron, and Paul Simonon from “The Clash”. Extensive footage from MacGowan’s past, in particular performances from the 1970s and 80s, presents an artist influenced by the traditions of Irish music and song, but also spurred on by the anti-establishment ethos and damaging excesses of the Punk Rock movement. Sarah Share presents an honest and compelling portrait of an evidently talented musician whose addiction to drugs and alcohol has seriously impeded his ambition and ability to maintain stability, in life and in his art. Songs featured include: Paddy public enemy No 1, If I should fall from grace with God, Infatuation, Gabrielle, Waxie’s dargle, Streams of whiskey, Dirty old town, The Irish rover, Fiesta, A Rainy night in Soho, Fairytale in New York, White city, Summer in Siam, Song with no name, That woman’s got me drinking, Haunted and Lonesome highway.

results.title: Idomeneo
results.creator_credit: Christopher Swann, Trevor Nunn, BBC-TV, Glyndebourne and RM Arts
results.brief_description: Heroic drama in three acts with music by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, libretto by Abbate Varesco, and performance by the Glyndebourne Chorus (Chorus Director - Jane Glover) and the London Philharmonic Orchestra (Leader - David Nolan) conducted by Bernard Haitink. This made for television production stars Philip Langridge (Idomeneo), Yvonne Kenny (Ilia), Jerry Hadley (Idamante), Carol Vaness (Electra), Thomas Hensley (Arbace) and Anthony Roden (High Priest). This is director Trevor Nunn’s debut into opera but recent credits include “Cats” and “The Life and Adventures of Nicholas Nickleby”.

results.title: Identifying and dealing with job burnout: trainers manual [text]
results.brief_description: The trainer’s manual to accompany the program of the same title and offers a transcript of the dramatised situation with discussion topics addressing identifying the symptoms of job burnout and appropriate strategies to overcome these. Various self-assessment exercises will enable the user to evaluate their own levels of job burnout and to personalise an action plan to deal with it. The video tape may be borrowed as a separate loan item.

results.title: Identifying and dealing with job burnout
results.brief_description: Job burnout is a serious problem. It can not only destroy a career, but affect relationships, personal health and self-esteem. This program presents a dramatisation which identifies the symptoms of job burnout, examines possible causes and offers several key strategies which will assist in reducing the effects. Introduces the SPACE strategy involving Social supports, Powerful thoughts, Autonomy, Confronting your stress and Extending your skills. Accompanied by a training manual which may be borrowed as a separate loan item.

results.title: Ida makes a movie
results.creator_credit: Kit Hood, Linda Schuyler and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Ida decides to make a film about garbage and enter it in a children’s filmmaking festival. She receives a notice that her film has been selected as a finalist, but the jury has decided that Ida’s film is about war. She is in a dilemma - should she tell the awards committee the truth or remain silent? She decides to go to the awards and take her chances. When she wins first prize she steps forward and tells the audience and the judges the true story. Truth and Ida both win.

results.title: Ichabod and Mr Toad
results.creator_credit: Clyde Geronimi, Jack Kinney, James Algar, Walt Disney and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Contains two classic Disney animated adaptations: Washington Irving’s ‘The Legend of Sleepy Hollow’ and Kenneth Grahame’s ‘The Wind in the willows’. These delightful stories feature the wonderful voices of Bing Crosby (narrator of the Legend of Sleepy Hollow) and Basil Rathbone (narrator of The Wind in the willows) supported by Eric Blore, Pat O’Malley, Colin Campbell, Campbell Grant and others.

results.title: Icebreakers
results.brief_description: This video is aimed at anyone involved with presenting at meetings, seminars, running a course or a workshop and working with small groups of people who don’t know each other that well or who don’t know each other at all. Icebreakers are fundamental in any successful delivery and this program provides a look at eight icebreakers that can be used in a variety of situations. Includes a Training Manual.

results.title: Icarus = Icare (K)
results.creator_credit: Paul Bochner, Wolf Koenig and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: The Greek myth retold by film animation, accompanied by music for flute written by Eldon Rathburn. Music, drawing, colour and movement here follow a moving classic restraint. Daedalus, inventor of many things, provides the wings to escape from Crete but Icarus, his son, impetuously flies too high. In this film, artist and composer share equal pleasure in the telling, with a feeling the audience will share. A film without words. Award: Oberhausen

results.title: IC - a shrinking world
results.creator_credit: Henry R. Feinberg, John Rimo and Bell Telephone Laboratories
results.brief_description: Uses animation and color photography - much of it shot through a microscope to convey the story of integrated circuits, electronic circuits smaller than a grain of salt.
